intro: Eriogonum compositum var. compositum, commonly known as the composite buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, edible seeds. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
